zero.name: Juhu Beach
zero.description: Juhu Beach is located in Mumbai, India and is one of the dirtiest beaches in the country. Each day, trucks and excavators attempt to remove the trash but new trash constantly washes up along the shore. Therefore, further waste-management services are required in order to make the beach clean.

one.name: Philippines, Freedom Island
one.description: Freedom Island is located in the Philippines, and its beach is on the top 5 list of dirtiest beaches in the world. Even though about 400 truckloadsâ€™ worth of trash was cleared from the beach, garbage continues to remain along the coastline. Thus, a more effective method of removing the trash is needed in order to make the beach habitable.

two.name: Henderson Island
two.description: Henderson Island is located in the Pitcairn Islands, a British territory situated about 3,400 miles from the coast of Chile. About 37 million articles of trash are on its beaches and certain conservation organizations have attempted to save the island from permanent damage.

three.name: Kuta Beach
three.description: Kuta Beach is located in Indonesia, the country that is ranked #2 in global marine pollution. Indonesia is known for its intense monsoon season, and coincidentally, it is during this time where the rate of trash disposal on the beach is highest. This makes Kuta Beach a target for many marine protection organizations.

four.name: Gringo Beach
four.description: Gringo Beach is located in the Dominican Republic, and is on the list of the top dirtiest beaches in the world. The beach is infamous for toxic pollution, which includes chemical and pharmaceutical contamination. Although some organizations have made attempts to clean the beach, none have been successful.

five.name: Guanabara Bay
five.description: Gringo Beach is located in the Dominican Republic, and is on the list of the top dirtiest beaches in the world. The beach is infamous for toxic pollution, which includes chemical and pharmaceutical contamination. Although some organizations have made attempts to clean the beach, none have been successful.

six.name: Cabrillo National Monument
six.description: Our beautiful Point Loma! Let's not mess it up!

seven.name: Marina Beach
seven.description: Marina Beach is located in Chennai, India and is the site of toxic pollution. White foam puffs (likely from laundry detergent and other contaminants) populate the beach and it is known that these puffs could possibly cause skin damage. Therefore, this beach needs immediate attention from conservation organizations in order to eradicate the toxic pollution present.

eight.name: Point Reyes
eight.description: Point Reyes is located north of the city of San Francisco. It is the site of water contamination, possibly caused by the nearby cattle farms. Thus, the assistance of wildlife conservation organizations is needed in order to control the spread of waste near the beaches.

nine.name: Torrey Pines
nine.description: Torrey Pines beach is located in San Diego, California and is known to be one of the cleanest beaches in the nation. However in 2020, about a 4000-gallon sewage spill during a storm forced the closure of the beach. After measures were put in place in order to clean up the waste, the beach is now open to the public, thus demonstrating that wildlife conservation acts were successful.

ten.name: Destin Beach
ten.description: An incredible example of a beautiful coastline. With ocean conservation efforts, we can keep these beaches looking amazing!

eleven.name: Doheny Beach
eleven.description: Doheny Beach is located in Dana Point, California. It has been named the dirtiest beach in the state for 3 consecutive years. High levels of toxic bacteria have been detected, thus making it an attractive spot for wildlife conservation organizations.

twelve.name: Pattaya Beach
twelve.description: Pattaya Beach is located in Thailand, and is the site of numerous water quality issues. Black water is routinely discharged into the water near the beaches and has become a popularized problem of the city. Therefore, it is a target for many wildlife conservation organizations.

thirteen.name: Port Phillip Bay
thirteen.description: Port Phillip Bay is located in Melbourne, Australia. It has recently attracted the attention of the media, due to the accumulation of brown water near the beaches. Therefore, the help of wildlife conservation organizations is appreciated in order to maintain the cleanliness of the beach.

fourteen.name: Blackpool Beach
fourteen.description: Blackpool beach is located in the United Kingdom. Some water quality tests conducted on the beach have concluded that the beach is not particularly safe. Thus, the assistance of wildlife conservation organizations is needed in order to extract the contaminants from the water.
